ygData.subject: Re: My weapon setup, should i change it?
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye, i am lvl 18 and duel weild a combine long sword and a s long sword, I am thinking of going with a dwaver 3h axe just so that i can start bringer 2h up,
ygData.messageBody:
Aye, i am lvl 18 and duel weild a combine long sword and a s long sword, I
am thinking of going with a dwaver 3h axe just so that i can start bringer
2h up, but... I have 100stg 95 agl and 86 dex, man do i ecer swing hard and
fast, eve siinse i got lvl 18, i am duble hitting 4x each hand about 55% of
the trime. now once I hit mid way in 18, i am heading over to hh, getting a
party together c\and camp the pgt out like shit!! after that is done, i
might talk with a few guild memeber 9 i am lowest level) and they might get
me a pinbringer gnoulsbane. i'm not to muxh into the gnoulsbane couse i
love fast weapons, pgt is like 22dealy and painbringer is like 23, i cwan't
wait for level 20 for my beserker, so that i'll be hit 3x the dmg + 1 X
.5(stg"100) I can start hitting for about 50-60 each hand.


----Original Message Follows----
From: "John Cynkar" <ref145@...>
Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
To: <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Subject: [warriors_eq] My weapon setup, should i change it?
Date: Thu, 15 Jul 1999 13:04:10 -0500

At lvl 19 i dual wield a PGT and a Bladed thulian Claw (demon claw). I love
dual wield but evryone keeps telling me I should buy a Blackened Iron
bastard sword. Sure i thinbk that weapon is great, but i like going fast.
Anyone have an opinion on what i should choose?

Also, i ran into a player whom decided to make a warrior instead of use his
lvl 27 paladin or something like that. He tought me how dex and agl was the
way to go for him instead of str. So he put all his points into those
instead of str. I am thinking of only getting items that increse agl and
dex, so i can be an excellent tank. sure the str might not be up, but you
will be fast and very hard to hit. This is just what he told me and I
thought it was neat..


Dubas of the 19th rank.
Mith. Marr
